column5: hello all im happy to say we have 6" of ice on our spot where it was open water last week,we lost the fisrt 100 yards out from shore last week during that rain/wind and mild spell we had,out farther we have 8". tonight we iced 3 walleye 1-5lber,1-3lber and 1-2lber and to our surprise a 2lb hearing. im pleased to say we will be back renting ice huts next week end jan 26th. i did not take my camera out so i have no pics to share just a story to tell.(forgot the camera on my desk  )  taker easy all  Hawg Hunter
do you have a website for your hut rentals?
I operate out of Carra Outdoor Sports in Belleville you can go to his site and book from there heres his info   Booking info here  taker easy  Hawg Hunter
No pictures eh? Are you sure it wasn't an Atlantic Salmon?
Thats some real nice sized walleyes for sure !!!!...well done,and im glad to hear the bay is getting safe again,we are heading there in 2 weeks thanks for sharing....cheers
well seeing as i have never landed one and have little knowledge my buddy tells me that YES indeed it was a white fish that he landed. so much for what i thought  .  Hawg Hunter
do you know the condition around the narrows?
Hi Pickman,  The Narrows is open and not safe as of yet.  Regards, Sam
Where do you guys figure will be decent areas to try this weekend? I am planning to head out for the day on saturday. Was thinking of the lighthouse, the big island or the shipwreck?
YEP Sams right i could have put a boat in there on sat .  Hawg Hunter
hope to see you again in about 3 weeks....keep us posted

Hi Jedimaster,  Shipwreck is not safe the ice has just covered that area and I would say being new ice it might be about an inch thick. That whole area has new ice and I would wait for a while until you think of going out there. You might get lucky for the weekend however I would be on the cautious side and wait a liitle bit longer.  Best regards, Sam
Sam, thanks for the info on the narrows, we are heading up to Baycrest on Thursday. Loooking forward to it as we missed out last year due to poor ice.
